ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.2_0: At that time the nuns stored one of their robes with other nuns and then left to wander in the country in a sarong and an upper robe.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.3_0: Because they were stored for a long time, the robes became moldy.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.4_0: When the nuns put them out to sun them,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.7_0: And they told them what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.8_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.9_0: “How can nuns store one of their robes with other nuns and then leave to wander in the country in a sarong and an upper robe?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.10_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.15_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.16.1_0: ‘If a nun does not move her robes for more than five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.5_0: Does not move her robes for more than five days:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.6_0: if she does not wear or sun her five robes on the fifth day, then, when the fifth day has passed, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.1_0: If it is more than five days, but she perceives it as less, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.2_0: If it is less than five days, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.3_0: If it is more than five days, but she perceives it as less, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.4_0: If it is less than five days, but she perceives it as more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.5_0: If it is less than five days, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.6_0: If it is less than five days and she perceives it as less, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.2_0: if she wears robe-cloth for five days or more than five days;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.6_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.7_0: The fourth training rule is finished.
